definition: (old)(interjection expressing disapproval, commiseration etc) tut!/Taiwan pr. [duo4]
(old)(interjection expressing disapproval, commiseration etc) tut!/Taiwan pr. [duo4]
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: I've always believed that aggressive southpaws are able to put hands on Marquez.
sentences.chinese: 我一直認爲咄咄逼人的左撇子拳手能夠擊中馬奎茲。

sentences.english: Why are Chinese jets being aggressive against any non-Chinese military presence here?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼中國飛機對南海的非中國軍事存在咄咄逼人。

sentences.english: His relentless aggression bludgeons you into seeing his point.
sentences.chinese: 他咄咄逼人地強迫你瞭解他的看法。

sentences.english: And to her it seemed that the angle of his jaw had changed; its pitch had become unpleasantly aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 在她眼裏他那下齶已棱角畢露，開合時咄咄逼人。

sentences.english: One mistake other guys make is to be too aggressive with women.
sentences.chinese: 有些人常犯的一個錯誤是他們追女人時太咄咄逼人了。

sentences.english: An insistent voice instructed him to paint a wall of the room in black.
sentences.chinese: 一個咄咄逼人的聲音指示他把房間的一面牆漆成黑色。

sentences.english: Couple that with an aggressive action oriented leader like Modi at the helm.
sentences.chinese: 結合咄咄逼人行動方向調換領袖像是Modi來管事。

sentences.english: Apple has made aggressive inroads in the education market.
sentences.chinese: 在教育市場，蘋果有着咄咄逼人的發展勢頭。

sentences.english: Conservatives generally criticize liberals for wanting obtrusive big government.
sentences.chinese: 保守黨一般批評自由黨想要咄咄逼人的大政府。

sentences.english: It is more convincing to behave calmly and unhurriedly than to air aggressively.
sentences.chinese: 從容不迫的舉止比咄咄逼人的態度更能讓人折服。

sentences.english: Perhaps I was too saucy and provoking .
sentences.chinese: 可能是我太莽撞無禮，咄咄逼人了。

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
